intro: Descurainia argentina, commonly known as the Argentine Tansy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is often found in the Andean regions of Argentina and Chile. Descurainia argentina is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
